Skills.name: Axe Master
Skills.text: The warrior may parry with normal axes as per normal parrying rules.

Skills.name: Disarm
Skills.text: The hero may exchange his normal attacks for a single special attack: Declare what weapon is attempted to disarm. The attack is executed at -2 WS (-3 for Two-Handed Weapon). If the to-hit roll is successful, the opponent must fight without the designated weapon until he recovers it. The foe recovers his weapon in the first Recovery Phase out of close combat. Not vs. natural weaponry.

Skills.name: Drive Chariot
Skills.text: The hero may Charge with its chariot.

Skills.name: Expert Axeman
Skills.text: Re-roll all failed hits with an Axe when charging.

Skills.name: Expert Swordsman
Skills.text: The hero may re-roll to-hit rolls with swords (normal swords or weeping blades) when charging.

Skills.name: Combat Master
Skills.text: The hero is immune to ‘All Alone’ test and gains an additional Attack when fighting two or more enemies at once.

Skills.name: Finishing Move
Skills.text: The hero may exchange his normal attacks for a single special attack: This attack is made at +2 Strength (any other Strength Bonus also applies e.g. Mighty Blow, weapon bonus, etc.) The blow is resolved last AFTER Two-Handed Weapons.

Skills.name: Follow Thru
Skills.text: In any Hand-to-Hand combat where all of the warrior’s foes are knocked down, stunned, or taken out of action the warrior may opt to move up to 2 inches in any direction. This move can bring him into base contact with another model, and he will fight in the next close combat phase, but neither model counts as charging. This move is executed at the very end of the close combat phase after everyone has finished striking. If multiple models have this skill, then they move in Initiative order. Simultaneous movers from opposing forces within range automatically move to intercept one another.

Skills.name: Pugilist
Skills.text: The model always gets an extra attack when fighting barehanded or with one weapon and no shield or buckler. Off-hand attacks have no penalty to hit.

Skills.name: Strike to Injure
Skills.text: The hero adds +1 to all injury rolls.

Skills.name: Shield Smash
Skills.text: Gain an additional attack (resolved at the warriors strength) when using a Shield or Buckler. This attack is resolved at -1 to hit and cannot cause critical hits.

Skills.name: Step Aside
Skills.text: The hero gains a special 5+ save against wounds suffered in close combat (as long as he is not wearing heavy armor).

Skills.name: Sweeping Blow
Skills.text: The hero may exchange his normal attacks for a single special attack (if equipped with a two-handed weapon including halberds, flails, etc.): All models in base contact have to take an Initiative test. If the test is failed, the model is hit. No Strength bonuses from weapons are applied when rolling to wound and rolling for armor saves.

Skills.name: Two Weapon master
Skills.text: The hero ignores the -2 to hit penalty for off-hand weapons.

Skills.name: Weapons Training
Skills.text: The Hero may use any close combat weapon, not just those in the equipment options.

Skills.name: Web of Steel
Skills.text: The hero gains +1 to rolls on the Critical Hit tables.

Skills.name: Whip Master
Skills.text: The hero may reroll all to-hit rolls when using a whip.

Skills.name: Alchemist
Skills.text: Roll a D6 to see which Alchemist ability the hero gains. If this skill is gained more than once and the roll would grant the same ability as the hero already has, roll again.

Skills.name: Arcane Lore
Skills.text: Any warrior with this skill may learn Lesser Magic if he owns a Tome of Magic.

Skills.name: Battle Tongue
Skills.text: Increases the range of the 'Leader' skill by 6".

Skills.name: Haggle
Skills.text: The Hero may deduct 2D6 gold crowns from the price of any single item (to a minimum cost of 1gc) once per post battle sequence.

Skills.name: Hunch
Skills.text: The warband may position up to 3 of his men capable of earning experience in any ruined building on the board that is at least 12 inch away from an enemy model and not in the enemy deployment zone.

Skills.name: Magical Aptitude
Skills.text: The hero may attempt to cast two spells each turn as long as he is not in hand-to-hand combat. After attempting the first spell, he must take a toughness test. If he passes he may attempt a second spell that turn or even cast the same spell twice. If he fails he must roll on the injury table immediately with no saves treating Out Of Action results as Stunned instead.

Skills.name: Medical Knowledge
Skills.text: You may reroll the units dice from a roll on the heros serious injury chart for one hero if this hero was not taken out of action.

Skills.name: Mind Focus
Skills.text: The hero may reroll one dice roll used in the difficulty roll.

Skills.name: Pawnbroker
Skills.text: Gain an extra 2D6 for every item Sold (up to its full value) if this hero was not taken out of action.

Skills.name: Scholar
Skills.text: The hero may select a spell or prayer instead of determining it randomly when gaining a new spell or prayer OR The difficulty of any spell or prayer the hero already knows is permanently reduced by 1.

Skills.name: Scribe
Skills.text: The hero may make a scroll before the battle and inscribe a single spell or prayer upon it that he is versed in. The scroll may be used just before they are about to cast the spell or prayer and allows the caster +2 to his difficulty roll. Once used the scroll will crumble to dust and is useless. Scrolls may not be saved up from battle to battle if they are not used.

Skills.name: Sorcery
Skills.text: The hero gains +1 to his casting rolls.

Skills.name: Streetwise
Skills.text: The hero may add +2 to the roll when searching for rare items.

Skills.name: Tactician
Skills.text: In any scenario the warband leader may reposition his warriors after his opponent has set up and may even advance them up to 12 inch onto the board instead of 8 inch.

Skills.name: Trap Expert
Skills.text: The Hero  will never set off traps himself (but may be subject to their effects if he is too close to one if it goes off). He can attempt to disarm any traps he comes across. He must stop at the trap during his Movement phase, and may do nothing else that turn. To disarm a Simple trap, he must roll 6+ on 2D6. To disarm a Complex trap, he must roll 8+ on 2D6. If unsuccessful, he must test against his Initiative. A failed test means he has inadvertently set off the trap himself! He is also able to restore dud traps or previously de-activated traps back into active traps. To determine what a Dud trap becomes, roll a D6: 1-4: Simple, 5-6: Complex. Obviously a previously disarmed trap will revert back to what it was. If restoring a Simple trap, he must roll a 6+ on 2D6. If restoring a Complex trap, he must roll an 8+. Failure will mean that the trap has failed to activate.

Skills.name: Wyrdstone Hunter
Skills.text: You may re-roll one dice when rolling on the Exploration chart.

Skills.name: Leap
Skills.text: The hero may leap D6" in the movement phase after making his other movements (charge, run, etc.). A leaping warrior may jump over opposing man-sized models, including enemies, and obstacles 1" high, without penalty. The leap may also be used to leap over gaps, but in this case you must commit the warrior to making the leap before rolling the dice to see how far he jumps. If he fails to make it all the way across, he falls through the gap (see page 6).

Skills.name: Sprint
Skills.text: The hero adds +D6 to his charge distance and may triple his Movement rate when he runs, rather than doubling it as normal.

Skills.name: Acrobat
Skills.text: The hero may fall or jump from a height of up to 12" without taking any damage if he passes a single Initiative test, and can re-roll failed Diving Charge rolls. He can still only make a diving charge from a height of up to 6".

Skills.name: Lightning Reflexes
Skills.text: If the hero is charged he gains ‘Strike First’ for this turn. Compare the initiative values of the hero and the attacker to see who strikes first.

Skills.name: Dodge
Skills.text: The hero can avoid any hits from a missile weapon on 5+. The roll is taken immediately after being hit and before any effects from other skills or equipment (such as lucky charms). Cannot be used when mounted.

Skills.name: Scale Sheer Surfaces
Skills.text: The hero can climb up or down a height equal to twice his normal Movement and does not need to make Initiative tests when doing so.

Skills.name: Fast Strike
Skills.text: The hero may exchange his normal attacks for a single special attack: Pick a single weapon. Add d6 to his Initiative (max 10). Not usable with any weapon that requires 2 Hands to use.

Skills.name: Roll Dodge
Skills.text: The hero cannot be intercepted when charging. Cannot be used when mounted.

Skills.name: Fleet Footed
Skills.text: The warrior gains +1 to his base Movement.

Skills.name: Jump Up
Skills.text: The hero may ignore Knocked Down results when rolling for injuries, unless he is Knocked Down because of a successful save from wearing a helmet.

Skills.name: Spry
Skills.text: The hero may run or charge while climbing (e.g. he may run to a wall and start climbing in the same turn).

Skills.name: Tunnel Rat
Skills.text: Any characteristic based test taken for Scenarios which are underground can be re-rolled by this hero.

Skills.name: Sneaky
Skills.text: All enemy models have their initiative range halved when trying to spot this warrior while he is hidden.

Skills.name: Flee
Skills.text: If the Hero breaks and runs while in close combat, his opponents do not get an automatic hit upon him. Rather, they hit on a 4+. Additionally, the Hero's player may roll 3d6 instead of the normal 2d6 and pick which 2 dice he prefers to determine the number of inches the Hero flees.

Skills.name: Mighty Blow
Skills.text: The hero adds +1 to wound in close combat (except with pistols). Critical hit chances are not changed by this.

Skills.name: Pit Fighter
Skills.text: The warrior has learned how to fight in enclosed spaces from his time in the dangerous fighting pits of the Empire. He is an expert at fighting in confined areas and adds +1 to his WS and +1 to his Attacks if he is fighting inside buildings or ruins. It’s a good idea to define which bits of your terrain collection count as buildings or ruins at the start of a battle to avoid confusion later.

Skills.name: Resilient
Skills.text: All enemies gain -1 to Strength against this hero in close combat. This does not affect the armour modifiers.

Skills.name: Fearsome
Skills.text: The model causes fear in opposing models.

Skills.name: Strongman
Skills.text: The hero may use a double-handed weapon without the usual penalty of always striking last.

Skills.name: Unstoppable Charge
Skills.text: The hero adds +1 to his Weapon Skill when charging.

Skills.name: Bell Ringer
Skills.text: 1 Attack Only, +1 to hit, +1 Strength, no Weapon Bonuses, foe Stunned on a 2-5 on Injury Chart.

Skills.name: Untiring
Skills.text: When wielding Flails and Morning Stars, the Hero may use the Strength Bonuses every close combat phase of the game, not just the first round of close combat.

Skills.name: Strong Legs
Skills.text: The Hero may use Heavy Armour and a Shield without suffering Movement penalties.

Skills.name: Tin Can
Skills.text: The hero may use any armor, not just those in the equipment options.

Skills.name: Weightlifter
Skills.text: The hero my run when carrying crates or barrels. He can also carry items alone that normally require two persons to carry.

Skills.name: Dirty Blow
Skills.text: The hero gains -1 Attack in the close combat round he uses this attack. All remaining attacks are executed without weapon or strength modifiers, but therefore ignore armor saves.

Skills.name: Rigger
Skills.text: boat stuff…

Skills.name: Handyman
Skills.text: wagon stuff…

Skills.name: Utter Determination
Skills.text: May re-roll one failed rout test per battle.

Skills.name: Righteous Fury
Skills.text: The warrior hates all Skaven, Undead and Possessed warbands and all models in them.

Skills.name: Sign of Sigmar
Skills.text: When fighting a member of any Undead or Possessed warband, these enemies lose their first attack (to a minimum of 1) in the first round of combat.

Skills.name: Protection of Sigmar
Skills.text: If any spell which would affect this model, roll a D6. On a roll of 4+, the spell is countered (treat it as if it was never cast).

Skills.name: Absolute Faith
Skills.text: The warrior may re-roll any 'Fear' tests and does not need to take 'All alone' tests.

Skills.name: Bulging Biceps
Skills.text: The Pit Fighter may ignore the entire heavy weapons special rule penalty. The Strength bonus will now apply to all rounds in CC. So a Morning Star will give +1 Strength in all turns not only the first one.

Skills.name: Master of Blades
Skills.text: When using a weapon that has a Parry special rule, this hero gains a +1 on the parry roll. If using two parry weapons, instead of an additional +1 to parry he can now re-roll one parry OR parry another separate attack.

Skills.name: Extra Tough
Skills.text: When rolling on the Heroes Serious Injury chart for this Hero after a game in which he has been taken Out Of Action, the dice may be re-rolled once. The result of this second dice roll must be accepted, even if it is a worse result.

Skills.name: Resource Hunter
Skills.text: If not taken out of action, one dice roll may be modified by +1/-1 when rolling on the Exploration chart.

Skills.name: True Grit
Skills.text: When rolling on the Injury table for this Hero, a roll of 1-3 is treated as Knocked Down, 4-5 as Stunned, and 6 as Out Of Action.

Skills.name: Thick Skull
Skills.text: The hero has a 3+ save on a D6 to avoid being stunned. If the save is made, treat a Stunned result as Knocked Down instead. This save is 2+ instead of 3+ if a Helmet is worn.

Skills.name: Shaggy Hide
Skills.text: The Beastman gains a 6+ Armour Save that can be combined with other armour as normal.

Skills.name: Mutant
Skills.text: The Beastman may buy one mutation

Skills.name: Fearless
Skills.text: The Beastman is Immune to Fear and All Alone tests.

Skills.name: Horned One
Skills.text: The Beastman gains an additional attack with its base strength when charging

Skills.name: Manhater
Skills.text: The Beastman gains Hatred(Humans)

Skills.name: Bellowing Roar
Skills.text: May re-roll one failed rout test per battle.

Skills.name: Infiltration
Skills.text: This Skaven model is not deployed with the others but after opponents have placed their models. It can be placed anywhere on the battlefield as long as it is out of sight of enemies and more than 12" away from any enemy model.

Skills.name: Wall Runner
Skills.text: The model does not need to take an Initiative test when climbing walls.

Skills.name: Tail Fighting
Skills.text: The Skaven may wield a Shield, Knife or Sword with its tail. The model gains an extra attack with the appropriate weapon or +1 to it's armour save.

Skills.name: Leader
Skills.text: Any model within 6" may use the Leaders Leadership instead of its own.

Skills.name: Charge
Skills.text: The model fights with 2 attacks instead of 1 during the turn they charge.

Skills.name: May not Run
Skills.text: This model is slow to react and may not run (but charge as normal)

Skills.name: Immune to Psychology
Skills.text: This model is not affected by psychology (such as fear) and never leave combat.

Skills.name: Immune to Poison
Skills.text: This model is not affected by any poison.

Skills.name: No Pain
Skills.text: This model treats the 'stunned' result on the injury chart as 'knocked down'.

Skills.name: Drunken
Skills.text: Roll a D6 at the start of each turn. At a roll of 1, the unit must test for Stupidity that turn. On a roll of 6, the unit becomes Frenzied for that turn. On a roll or 2-5 nothing happens.

Skills.name: Trample
Skills.text: Counts as an additional attack that does not benefit from weapon bonuses or penalties.

Skills.name: Animal
Skills.text: The model may not carry loot.

Skills.name: Broken Leg
Skills.text: The model gains -1 Movement.

Skills.name: Smashed Leg
Skills.text: The model may not run.

Skills.name: Burn the Witch!
Skills.text: Hates all models who can cast spells.

Skills.name: Fanatical
Skills.text: The model automatically passes all Leadership-based tests they need to take.

Skills.name: Bloodgreed
Skills.text: Whenever the model puts all of its enemies in hand-to-hand combat out of action, it becomes frenzied on a roll of 4+.

Skills.name: Large
Skills.text: Any model may shoot at this model even if it is not the closest target.

Skills.name: Perfect Killer
Skills.text: Armour Penetration +1 (both shooting and melee)
